## State Parks and Elevations

This interactive dashboard shows the highest elevation for each U.S. state park. Hover over each data point to see an image of the park.

```{r panel A, parks and evelations}
#install.packages("flexdashboard")
library(flexdashboard)
library(ggplot2)
library(plotly)
library(dplyr)


# Sample data for state parks (replace with your actual data)
state_parks_data <- data.frame(
  park_name = c("Yellowstone", "Yosemite", "Everglades", "Rocky Mountain", "Grand Canyon"),
  highest_elevation = c(11350, 13000, 8, 14110, 7460),  # Elevations in feet
  park_image_url = c("https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/9/9f/Yellowstone_National_Park_logo.svg/800px-Yellowstone_National_Park_logo.svg.png",
                     "https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/0/09/Yosemite_park_logo.png",
                     "https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/a/ae/Everglades_National_Park_Logo.jpg",
                     "https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/1/1b/Rocky_Mountain_National_Park_logo.svg/800px-Rocky_Mountain_National_Park_logo.svg.png",
                     "https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/0/01/Grand_Canyon_National_Park_Logo.jpg")
)

# Create the plot
fig <- plot_ly(state_parks_data, x = ~park_name, y = ~highest_elevation, type = 'scatter', mode = 'markers',
               text = ~paste('<b>', park_name, '</b><br>Elevation: ', highest_elevation, 'ft',
                             '<br><img src="', park_image_url, '" width="150px">'),
               hoverinfo = 'text', marker = list(size = 12))

# Set layout
fig <- fig %>% layout(
  title = "Highest Elevation in U.S. State Parks",
  xaxis = list(title = "Park Name"),
  yaxis = list(title = "Highest Elevation (ft)"),
  hoverlabel = list(bgcolor = "white", font = list(size = 12)),
  annotations = list(
    x = 0.5,
    y = 1.05,
    text = "Hover to see park images",
    showarrow = FALSE,
    font = list(size = 16, color = "black"),
    xref = "paper",
    yref = "paper"
  )
)

fig
```
